description: Inherited from Middle English fruytles; equivalent to fruit +‎ -less. Compare Middle English withouten fruyt (“fruitless”, literally “without fruit”).

adjectives.description: fruitless (comparative more fruitless, superlative most fruitless)

examples: The unskilled man’s attempt at fixing his car engine was fruitless.

entries.meaning: (figuratively, archaic) Of a person: unable to have children; barren, infertile.
examples: The fruitless woman desperately wanted to have children.

entries.meaning: (rare) Of a diet, etc.: without fruit.
